results.title: The Silence of the lambs
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Ron Bozman, Kenneth Utt, Edward Saxon, Strongheart Films and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Thomas Harris, “Silence of the Lambs” is a disturbing and chilling thriller. The film which won five Academy Awards, is highlighted by the superb performances of Jodie Foster as FBI cadet Clarice Starling and Anthony Hopkins as the psychotic criminal, once brilliant psychiatrist, Dr. Hannibal “the Cannibal” Lecter. Starling’s job is to tap Lector’s mind in order to find the serial killer known as “Buffalo Bill”, a killer who skins his victims. Lector uses his macabre knowledge to entice Clarice into intricate but chilling mindgames. The film’s focal point is not so much the catching of the killer, but the relationship between Starling and Lector. The audience is manipulated so that Lecter is simultaneously repellent and charismatic, thus contributing to the tension and unease of the film.

results.title: The Omega man
results.creator_credit: Boris Sagal, Walter Seltzer and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Welcome to the future where humankind has been decimated due to the effects of biological warfare. Robert Neville, played by Charlton Heston, roams the windy, ghostly streets of Los Angeles, searching for supplies. At sundown, other “survivors” emerge; the blood-thirsty “Family”, neopeople who are not quite human. Rosalind Cash stars as the caretaker of a small but healthy band of children who represent the future of our species. Together, she and Heston, must keep them from “The Family’s” grasp. Based on Richard Matheson’s classic sci-fi novel “I am a legend”.

results.title: The Odd couple
results.creator_credit: Gene Saks, Howard W. Koch and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the Neil Simon play, Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon star in this offbeat comedy about two divorced men who try to share an apartment in New York without killing each other. Lemmon plays the irritating Felix Unger, obsessive and fussy, who proves that cleanliness is not a virtue, but a mental illness! Matthau, plays the slob Oscar Madison, who wreaks havoc on a room with the speed and thoroughness of a tornado. The performances are excellent, and the precision timing of the two actors infuses the film with a sense of spontaneity.

results.title: The Power of one
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises, Studio Canal+ and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bryce Courtenay, this is the story of a young English boy named PK. Orphaned in a foreign land and terrorized for his political beliefs by his schoolmates, the pint-sized youngster turns to the only friend who can help him: a kindly yet world-wise prison inmate who teaches him how to box. As he grows into manhood, he takes on the system and social injustices which arise from Apartheid. Stars Stephen Dorff, Morgan Freeman and Sir John Gielgud and photographed by Australian Dean Semler. One person really can make a difference.

results.title: Indochine [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Regis Wargnier, Jean Labadie, Eric Heumann, Cine 5, Orly Films, Bac Films (France), La Generale D'Images and Paradis Films
results.brief_description: Set in 1930 in French Indochina, on the cusp of revolution, the 1993 Academy Award Winning Best Foreign Film, “Indochine” is the epic story of two women; a French mother and her adopted Indochinese daughter. Their relationship survives social and cultural obstacles, but is ultimately stretched to extremes by their passionate love for the same man. The awesome beauty of Vietnam provides a perfect backdrop for this splendid film. Catherine Deneuve gives a “tour de force” performance. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Paper
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Frederick Zollo, Brian Grazer and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: Today, Henry Hackett (Michael Keaton), Metro editor of a New York tabloid has to make big decisions. His heavily pregnant wife (Marisa Tomei) is facing urgent deadlines of her own. Henry’s boss, the managing editor (Glenn Close) is also reaching a crisis in her life and her senior (Robert Duvall) has just discovered he is an extremely sick man. To top it all, the paper is in pursuit of a hot story that could expose a major scandal and free two innocent boys charged with murder if they can beat the deadline. With the clock ticking, the tension mounts and somewhere amidst the chaos are moments that could change these people’s lives forever. Directed by Ron Howard and also starring Randy Quaid, this film is an inside look at the ruthless and sometimes savage newspaper business.

results.title: The Little foxes
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn, Goldwyn Productions and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the stage play by renown author Lillian Hellman, Bette Davis gives an extraordinary performance as Regina, an avaricious wife who will stop at nothing to outwit her brothers in controlling the family business. The cost of this greed results in the death of her ailing husband, Herbert Marshall and rejection by her daughter played by Teresa Wright. Nominated for nine Academy Awards, the acting in this production is flawless, and the story is filled with drama and suspense. The Hubbard family of the “Deep South” remain one of the most greedy and rapacious family’s bought to the screen.

results.title: Miller's Crossing
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and Circle Films
results.brief_description: Millers Crossing contains all the elements of the classic gangster cliches of this genre: fast women, guns and booze. The Coen brothers however have produced a film which is both “stylish and seamless”, and a “hero” who is both a man of principle and a murderer. Starring Albert Finney, Gabriel Byrne and Marcia Gay Harden, “Millers Crossing” tells the tale of Leo, a benevolent Irish gangster and his trusted lieutenant Tom Reagan. Their control is being threatened by the ever-increasing presence of the “Italians”. Caught in the grips of a gangland struggle, Tom must walk a tightrope as he tries to control and manipulate the outcome. The Coen’s have recreated the look and feel of the gangster era with stunning cinematography and a thrilling plot.

results.title: Mr. Deeds goes to town
results.brief_description: One of the most successful comedies, this is the story of Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), an unassuming, tuba-playing young country hick who inherits his uncle’s $20 million estate. He is catapulted from small-town peace to New York turmoil. Discovering he’s been duped by crooked big city associates and the beautiful girl reporter (Jean Arthur) whom he loves, Deeds decides to give away his fortune to the needy. His lawyer interprets this as a sign of insanity and a bitter courtroom battle ensues with Deeds refusing to testify. Only love can save the day. This timeless “little-man-against-the-world” comedy-drama won Capra the 1936 Academy Award for Best Director and received five Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor.

results.title: Mountains of the moon
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Daniel Melnick and Indieprod
results.brief_description: In the 1850’s, two British officers, Captain Richard Burton and Lieutenant John Hanning Speke, set out on a spectacular adventure to discover the source of the Nile. As they pushed deeper and deeper into the hitherto unexplored regions of the African wilderness, they forged strong bonds of friendship in order to survive the great dangers which befell them. It was ironical then, that a friendship which had endured so much in Africa, was ultimately destroyed by the rigidity and competitiveness of Victorian England and its aristocracy. Burton, played by Patrick Bergin, is a larger than life character; a “maverick” geographer whose love affair and marriage to Isabelle, (Fiona Shaw), was “the stuff from which legends were made”. Speke, (Iain Glen), was the son of an aristocrat, bound by the strict conventions of his time. Together they embarked on one of the greatest explorations in history. Divided, their friendship in tatters, and their reputations in jeopardy, Speke ended his life tragically, and Burton quit England.
